The plant features narrow, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, which help retain moisture. Its inflorescence consists of small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Lindsaea acutifolia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in shaded, moist conditions.
